answers.answer: Any foreigner who left his/her country of origin because he/she fears persecution, serious human rights violations or armed conflict can apply for asylum.
answers.bResponse: Any foreigner who left his/her country of origin because he/she fears persecution, serious human rights violations or armed conflict can apply for asylum. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum

answers.answer: After requesting asylum, you become an asylum seeker and cannot be deported back to your country of origin.
answers.bResponse: After requesting asylum, you become an asylum seeker and cannot be deported back to your country of origin. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum

answers.answer: The purpose of protecting foreigners from persecution and human rights violations is to allow them to seek safety and refuge in other countries where they may not face harm or danger.
answers.bResponse: The purpose of protecting foreigners from persecution and human rights violations is to allow them to seek safety and refuge in other countries where they may not face harm or danger. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum

answers.answer: Anyone who has entered Romania as a migrant can apply for asylum directly at the border crossing point or anywhere else in Romania. However, they cannot do so if they are outside the territory of Romania. As an asylum seeker, they will be provided with an asylum application form which can be filled out with assistance and can also be completed in their native language.
answers.bResponse: Anyone who has entered Romania as a migrant can apply for asylum directly at the border crossing point or anywhere else in Romania. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum

answers.answer: Asylum seekers can fill out their application directly at the border crossing point or anywhere in Romania after entering the country as a migrant. They cannot apply for asylum in Romania if they are outside its territory.

answers.answer: The asylum application form can be completed in the applicant's mother tongue, and it is also possible to fill it out using the assistance of an official or an official designated to receive the application. The standard form may be completed in both Romanian and English, but other languages are allowed too.

answers.answer: To apply for asylum in Romania, you must submit various documents related to your personal situation, including any supporting documentation. Additionally, you must provide a document showing your right to cross the Romanian state border. Once these documents are submitted, you will receive a temporary identification document issued by the General Inspectorate for Immigration (IGI) for asylum seekers.
